news.title: Pune: NGT allows construction at Baner project, but orders monitoring by MPCB
news.para: The National Green Tribunal has permitted construction to resume at a Baner real estate project, mandating Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB) monitoring for noise and dust pollution. The MPCB will assess the site within a week and determine if past violations warrant environmental damage compensation, while the Pune Municipal Corporation must establish construction pollution protocols.

news.title: NDMC launches cleanliness drive across key residential, commercial zones
news.para: The New Delhi Municipal Council is igniting a transformation with its latest cleanliness campaign. Different departments are uniting efforts to sweep away dust, remove silt, and elevate the beauty of green areas. This initiative specifically targets high-traffic residential and commercial zones, striving to minimize pollution and improve public health.

news.title: No permit fee for small plots in Uttar Pradesh
news.para: Uttar Pradesh government has waived building permit and inspection fees for residential plots under 1,076 sqft and small shops under 323 sqft. Amended byelaws now grant deemed approval for construction on these plots via an online platform. Revisions also broaden definitions of floor area ratio and layout plans, promoting vertical growth and updating building descriptions.

news.title: Odisha REAT upholds ORERA order requiring builder to obtain OC, transfer common areas
news.para: OREAT has ruled against a city realtor's challenge to an ORERA order, highlighting the importance of compliance in real estate development. The tribunal has required the promoter to secure completion and occupancy certificates for the 41-duplex project located in Janla.

news.title: Builders delaying EWS, LIG flats? Ghaziabad development body sets up panel to look into it
news.para: A six-member committee has been formed to investigate delays by private developers in allotting EWS and LIG residential units in Ghaziabad.  Complaints indicate developers are not providing possession to beneficiaries as mandated. The committee will submit a zone-wise report, and erring developers may face map approval cancellation.

news.title: Mumbai civic body conducts lottery draw for 426 houses
news.para: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation held an online draw for 426 homes.  373 applicants were successful in securing housing.  Another 362 applicants have been placed on a waiting list.    A further lottery for 296 residential units is planned soon.

news.title: Chandigarh administration estimates and plans optimal use of available land for future development
news.para: Chandigarh faces a land crunch with less than 10% remaining for expansion. The UT administration is mapping all vacant and earmarked plots for housing, commercial, and institutional use to optimize land utilization. Major land parcels are available in Phase III and the IT Park, with further development planned in peripheral areas.

news.title: Maharashtra grants legal status to digitally signed land records
news.para: Maharashtra has granted full legal status to digitally signed land records, including 7/12 and 8-A extracts, and property cards. This move is expected to significantly reduce lending risks and speed up land verification cycles, improving capital allocation in the real estate market. The policy aims to enhance transparency and confidence for investors and developers.

news.title: Nagpur: Probe ordered after allegations of scam over slum rehabilitating project
news.para: Industries Minister Uday Samant announced a 30-day inquiry into alleged scam involving BMC officials in Marol's Kondivita slum rehabilitation for road widening. Shiv Sena (UBT) MLC Anil Parab accused Assistant Municipal Commissioner Nitin Shukla and two engineers of duping slum dwellers to favour builders. Officials found involved will face dismissal.

news.title: Blackstone’s Horizon Parks said to file for $500 million IPO
news.para: Blackstone-backed Horizon Industrial Parks is preparing a Mumbai IPO of up to $500 million, among India’s largest logistics listings, with proceeds earmarked for asset expansion amid strong retail and institutional market appetite.

news.title: China Vanke seeks one-year extension on second onshore bond: Sources
news.para: China Vanke has proposed to postpone the repayment of a second onshore bond by an additional year as it grapples with ongoing financial hurdles stemming from a sustained slump in the property market. Bondholders are set to weigh in on this proposal on December 22, following a similar delay request for another bond that is due next week.

news.title: Gurugram: Owners of 32nd Avenue served notice for breaches in building code
news.para: Gurgaon authorities have issued a show-cause notice to 32nd Avenue owners. Inspections revealed violations of approved building and layout plans. These include encroachments and illegal conversions. Previous notices for similar breaches went unaddressed. Owners must appear on December 17, 2025, with relevant documents. Failure to comply could lead to demolition or sealing.

news.title: Lucknow development body to auction plots in Gomtinagar Extension Scheme
news.para: The Lucknow Development Authority (LDA) has finalized plot prices and approved layouts for commercial and group housing developments in Gomtinagar Extension. These prime plots, including commercial complexes, hospital land, and group housing sites, will be available in an upcoming e-auction starting December 15. The auction features plots in Sector-7, near 1090 Chauraha, and on Butler Palace Road.

news.title: ED conducts searches in Delhi-NCR on Angle Infrastructure, RP & Nauseva Buildwell LLP
news.para: The Enforcement Directorate conducted searches in Delhi-NCR. This action targets M/s Angle Infrastructure Pvt. Ltd and its partners. The investigation focuses on alleged collusion during a corporate insolvency resolution process. Unexplained cash of Rs 33 lakh and digital devices were seized. The probe stems from allegations of non-delivery of flats in the Krrish Florence Estate project.

news.title: BMC to auction six-acre Century mill land in Worli, Mumbai
news.para: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation is set to monetize prime land in Worli. Following a Supreme Court ruling, the civic body will auction nearly six acres of Century Cotton Textile Mill property. The land will be leased for 30 years, with an option for renewal. The base price is Rs 1,348 crore.

news.title: Another Mumbai bungalow to make way for redevelopment with ₹164-crore deal
news.para: A vintage bungalow in Santacruz west has been sold for Rs 164 crore. This prime property will be redeveloped into luxury apartments.  Such deals are common in the Bandra-Khar-Santacruz belt.  Developers are acquiring these plots for premium residential projects.  Demand for luxury homes remains strong.  This sale highlights the ongoing transformation of standalone homes into new housing stock.

news.title: Ghaziabad development body vested with power to change land use for townships
news.para: Ghaziabad Development Authority (GDA) board now has the power to change land use from agricultural to residential for townships under the CM Urban Expansion New City Promotion Scheme. This significant shift, previously requiring state government sanction, aims to expedite projects like Harnandipuram by resolving land-use delays.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh REAT asks builder to pay interest for delay in 45 days
news.para: A real estate tribunal has ordered a developer to compensate homebuyers for delays and refund charges for club and golf course facilities. The tribunal also mandated a probe into the Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority's role in approving project norms. This decision follows findings of fraudulent and deceptive practices by the promoter.

news.title: Ashiana Housing's MD elected president of CREDAI-NCR
news.para: Ashiana Housing's MD Vishal Gupta has taken the helm as the new president of CREDAI-NCR. The organization recently revealed its refreshed Executive Committee and Governing Council, with Gupta vowing to foster collaboration with government entities and various stakeholders.

news.title: Hongkong Land to launch $6.2 billion Singapore private real estate fund
news.para: Hongkong Land is gearing up to unveil its groundbreaking Singapore Central Private Real Estate Fund, aspiring to dominate the landscape of private real estate investments in Singapore. Targeting commercial properties, this fund is projected to become the largest in its category within the city-state.
